subject: A Trailer From Telltale
event:
Tellgame Tales has released another trailer for their new GAME OF THRONES videogame, IRON FROM ICE.

Enjoy.

<lj-embed id="517" />

comments.article:
The game trailer makes me as tense as the books and show! As a reader, writer and game player I'm looking forward to this being released to round off my whole GoT experience.

Mark
comments.subject: Looking great...

comments.article:
Cool!
It will be interesting to play in...
Finally! A worthy game of the Game of Thrones.
I reviewed it earlier. Amazing game. http://www.neverreallyawake.com/game-of-thrones-a-telltale-game-series-episode-1-review-iron-from-ice/
comments.subject: Review

comments.article:
Hello, I'm the new head Administrator at Game of Thrones Wiki: Is the game "TV-continuity"? Over at the wiki we're unsure of how to include it, no one tells us anything. So far we've been tentatively treating it as "near-canon" for the TV continuity. But some debate whether we should include info about "Ramsay Snow" from the video game on the "Ramsay Snow, TV series" article, or just make a separate one.

My hope is that the game is....the analogy I'd use is that old Cadfael mystery series, about a monk whose abbey is in a town on the Welsh border during the Anarchy between Stephen and Matilda. The main course of the civil war is going on, but the TV series zoomed in to show how it is affecting one tiny corner of England.

The more I heard about it the more I was impressed that they were actually respecting the source material - doing pretty much what I'd do for a spinoff game: not invent entirely new major Houses from scratch, but focus on the second-tier minor Houses that we rarely hear about, bannermen to Houses like the Glovers. And I was excited that they actually picked a House name that actually exists in the books (a "House Forrester" was mentioned as bannermen of the Glovers in ADWD).

Also sometimes it gets confusing to distinguish "major House" (Umber, Karstark, Glover) from "minor House" (Cassel, Poole, etc.) -- maybe it would have been better to call them "Barons" or something, and the major Houses "Lords"...but that's near 20 years water under the bridge at this point.

I know you don't write for the game but I didn't know if the other writers had at least mentioned, "yeah we're going to work in mentions about the Forresters in Season 5". They do something similar with the tie-in game for the SyFy series "Defiance" - David J. Peterson also created the alien languages for that show. The main live-action show will make stray references to characters from the game now and again.

P.S.

We've learned in the World book that Meraxes had "silver scales with golden eyes" - was Meraxes solid silver, or did it have gold as a secondary color along its horns and spine? Balerion was black with red highlights. What color was Vhagar?

Also from Yi Ti section of the World book, I can't wait to see the historical drama about Lo Doq, of the Scarlet Emperors. "Is there anyone in Si Qo who has not slept with my daughter?!?!" -- outstanding.
comments.subject: Canon status?

comments.article:
All I really control is what is "book canon" (the novels and the Dunk & Egg stories and the worldbook). It's up to HBO and David & Dan to determine what is "TV canon."

The Telltale guys worked with Ty Franck, who was my right hand here for half a decade.
comments.subject: Re: Canon status?

comments.article:
I felt it as well....after watching that trailer.

Has something awakened in you Mr. Martin?
I hope so.
May the force be with you!
comments.subject: Star Wars VII Trailer

comments.article: Ah... No, not really.
comments.subject: Re: Star Wars VII Trailer
chapter one of the Telltale game was great
Re: chapter one of the Telltale game was great

comments.article: Just finished the first episode. Easily as good as their superb Walking Dead game. Engrossing from beginning to end.
comments.subject: Wow

comments.article:
Telltale's got me addicted with The Walking Dead game. I'm still traumatized by my decisions towards the end of season one.

Been expecting this one for quite a while. From what I read from the reviews, it was worth the wait. Purchasing season pass to my PS4.

Thank you for another extension of the Ice and Fire saga!

Cheers from Brazil (come visit us, uncle Martin!)

While I desperately want this game, I think I'll wait to but the full season in one go. Something in me objects to paying per episode. Looks amazing though, Telltale seem to have done an amazing job yet again.

I've never played a Telltale game before, so I wasn't sure what to expect when I downloaded the game last night- but, WOW, this really captured the feel of Game of Thrones.

The story was well done and very true to not only the spirit of the show, but to the books as well. I'm now very impatiently waiting for the next episode! Great work by all involved. :)
comments.subject: Played though last night

comments.article: Have you played the first episode of this Telltale game, George? I just finished it and I can finally say for certain that I would not last too long in Westeros.
comments.subject: Telltale Game

comments.article: Since there is people commenting about star wars I will ask something directly to you George, I saw somewhere that you kinda helped with the chewbacca concept with one tale of yours with a creature that kinda inspired George Lucas to create it, is it true?

John Schoenherr, one of the great SF artists, painted a cover for a story of mine called "And Seven Times Never Kill Man."  Whether his art had any impact on Lucas or his designers, or whether they even saw it, I couldn't say... but the look is certainly similar.

Ice & Fire is so rich, why focus on the main plot line already being worked by HBO?! I mean, why not a game about the Baratheon take over? It would be truly great!
An open map game, like the assassin's creed series or Red Dead Redemption, that would be so amazing! They have The story, just need the guts to do it. Maybe you could persuade then Mr. Martin :)
comments.subject: Telltale Game

comments.article:
Hi, Are the words of the house "Iron from Ice" your own George? Or are they purely a Telltale concept? Did you have any specific input at all regarding this game or is it outside invention?

I have to admit that I have really enjoyed what I have played of it so far.
comments.subject: House Forrester

comments.article: All games about aSoIaF has amazing story and dialogs, but one moment is spoiling good impressions - very poor graphic realization. It's related to this game, and CYANIDE RPG game also. Now computer game come far away from ugly faces of characters and poor environment. Should we hope to see something with more close to modern computer graphic like The Elder Scrolls V - Skyrim and Dragon Age 3 : Inquisition? These Games has rich virtual world, which load players very deeply in story.

Little off topic, but still related to Westeros:

There was one thing I was curious about when it comes to Joffrey: was he asexual? Unless it was about sadism, he didn't seem to have the slightest interest in neither boys or girls. A prince/king in his teens in that kind of society would normally wake up with a new girl each morning if he was not obligated to someone.

Does it blow your mind that your story has become a video game?

I think that would be a "holy shit" moment for me.
comments.subject: As an author...

comments.article:
George,

Around this time of year you usually post and promote something about the Ice and Fire Calendar. Any word on next year's?
comments.subject: Calendar

comments.article: Great game, i honestly cant wait for more episodes. I played on ps4 and felt the game was in line with the atmosphere and feel of your world; i was blown away with the attention to detail in both the characters and the locations. On another note, how did you like the new star wars trailer? I cant wait for the movie, but am far more excited for your next book!
comments.subject: First of all...

comments.article: So glad this is on PS3 as well as PS4, it's gonna be another year at least before I buy a PS4.

I must say, as a great fan of stories, that I am absolutely thrilled to finally have a game of thrones game that lives up to the name. I've played both the cyanide game of thrones RPG on ps3 and game of thrones genesis (Strategy game) on the PC. Although the RPG did have a few memorable moments it was somewhat of a disappointment, although I did enjoy the maester Martin cameo, which was basically you with another voice who answer a bunch of questions about the lore of the world. The strategy game genesis was a better game and pretty entertaining for a few hours, especially marrying your kids and bastards to make alliances. However neither game did justice to your story or world.

After playing telltales game I am glad to say that there is a finally a game that lives up to the game of thrones brand. Fans of either the book or series, in my opinion, will undoubtedly enjoy this game. For those of you reading this that are unfamiliar with telltale (the game developer) their games are like an interactive TV show. They release their games as seasons, and each season generally has 5 episodes which release generally within a month or two apart. Also each episode is generally 2 hours long. So this game with all 5 episodes will be just as long if not longer than a season of game of thrones on HBO. They're great value as well. $5 an episode or $20 a season.

But anyways I just wanted to say I'm really happy about this game and enjoyed the first episode. Congratulations on another success and thank you for the many hours of my life you personally (or your mind) have given me.

Also thanks for world of ice and fire book, it kicks major ass.

Have a weird question for you if you have time to answer.
Will there ever be more info on the winged men, and will we see any of their ilk in the final two books? Ever since I've seen the city of winged men I've always wondered what's up with them. I wonder if they really fly, or do they just shoot living people out of catapults and have parachutes. Thanks Mr. Martin

Even if you're not much of a gamer yourself and therefore don't intend to play this, it's definitely worth at least watching someone else play it on YouTube or the like. It's entertaining watching the thought people put into making the various decisions they're presented with: stuff like whether to show mercy to a thief and deserter, demonstrating kindness and hopefully winning the love of your subjects but potentially leading others to think you're soft and trying their own luck at deserting/stealing, or whether to hack off his fingers, demonstrating strength but also showing yourself as cold-blooded and potentially condemning the man's family to starvation when the winter comes.

In most fantasy settings, the first approach would probably be the favored one. In Westeros, where things tend to be a bit more cynical, I imagine that any lord choosing to pardon a thief caught red-handed would be looked on as contemptibly weak and his perceived weakness taken advantage of by others.
good game. I ended up playing the first episode. it ends very suddenly)
